text: Hi, all. I wish to contribute to the Julia VSCode Extension for GSoC 2021. I have been working with TypeScript development since sophomore year. And during last fall, I worked on Julia as an MLH Fellowship student. I authored a package <https://github.com/JuliaGeo/GADM.jl|JuliaGeo/GADM.jl> under the mentorship of <@UA3UH56HL>, contributed several PRs to other Julia projects, and used the extension extensively. Going through the idealist, this one sounds the most aligned to my interests. <@U68UUUFPS> I would be glad if you can give some pointers on where to start with this idea: <https://julialang.org/jsoc/gsoc/vscode/#vs_code_extension>

elements.text: Hi, all. I wish to contribute to the Julia VSCode Extension for GSoC 2021. I have been working with TypeScript development since sophomore year. And during last fall, I worked on Julia as an MLH Fellowship student. I authored a package
, contributed several PRs to other Julia projects, and used the extension extensively. Going through the idealist, this one sounds the most aligned to my interests.
I would be glad if you can give some pointers on where to start with this idea:

text: You could do one of two things: 1) look through our issue list and see whether there ideas that jump out at you that seem to have the right size and that you are interested, or 2) if you're familiar with the extension and have some of your own ideas on what you want to add, let us know about that. For the latter case, probably best if you were to open an issue on the repo to propose the idea.

elements.text: You could do one of two things: 1) look through our issue list and see whether there ideas that jump out at you that seem to have the right size and that you are interested, or 2) if you're familiar with the extension and have some of your own ideas on what you want to add, let us know about that. For the latter case, probably best if you were to open an issue on the repo to propose the idea.

text: Sure thing. Thanks! I'll start with this.

elements.text: Sure thing. Thanks! I'll start with this.

text:
<@U68UUUFPS> I went through all the issues open and specifically the one with `Backlogs`

There were 2 areas that interested me the most:

1. Plotting - A lot of improvements can be done to the Plotpane, eg. Copy, Save, Zoom, Interactivity, etc.
    a. <https://github.com/julia-vscode/julia-vscode/issues/2034>
    b. <https://github.com/julia-vscode/julia-vscode/issues/1847>
    c. <https://github.com/julia-vscode/julia-vscode/issues/1655>
    d. <https://github.com/julia-vscode/julia-vscode/issues/1532>
2. Jupyter Notebook - Mostly the issues opened by DonJayamanne seemed interesting enough.
    e. <https://github.com/julia-vscode/julia-vscode/issues/2056>
    f. <https://github.com/julia-vscode/julia-vscode/issues/2051>
    g. <https://github.com/julia-vscode/julia-vscode/issues/2044>
I am not sure about what are the priorities of this project. Please help me out with refining the ideas so I can start with a draft proposal.
